description: From Middle English shamefast, schamefast, schamfast, sceomefest, from Old English sċamfæst (“modest”), corresponding to shame +‎ fast.

adjectives.description: shamefast (comparative more shamefast, superlative most shamefast)

examples: But the women are alwayes covered about their middles with a skin, and very shamefast to be seene bare.
